Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text: 5 ll. on recto and list of 16 witnesses on verso. Cession of one-seventh shares of property in the necropolis of Memphis, ceded by Achomnevis son of Petearendotes to the choachyte Imouthes son of Phkhoiphis. Cf. P BM EA 10241. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "The above belongs to the group of papyri which includes Leiden 379, Louvre 2412 and Brussels 3. and no. 10241 above".
Curator's comments: Andrews, 'papyrus BM 10381: An Inheritance of the Memphite Choachytes' in Res severa verum gaudium (Fs Zauzich; Leuven, Peeters 2004), 27-32. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48583) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48583)
Andrews 2002 / A Memphite miscellany: four new Demotic texts
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragile, loss Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Giovanni Anastasi ((suggested with doubt by Thompson's MS Catalogue by comparison with P BM EA 10241))
Acquisition notes: In her publication (in Fs Zauzich) Andrews suggests the possibility that the papyrus may come from the Athanasi Collection.
